channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 25th September
item.description:
Orbit sent email via Customer Service Email: Dear help desk I am writing to formally request the removal of rubbish on the pathway off Abbey Road leading into Fendyke Road by Buckles Court. This pathway falls under the responsibility of the local authority, and its current condition is both unsightly and poses serious safety risks to our vulnerable residents, including wheelchair users and those using walking frames. Given the potential hazards, l urge that arrangements be made to have the rubbish cleared as soon as possible. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Regards
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree needs trimming at base by St Mary’s Close, 25th September
item.description:
The big tree by St Mary’s Close needs trimming around the base / trunk please because the trunk is hidden .

item.title: Lime bikes overcrowded blocking around 55 BakerStreet building, 25th September
item.description:
Lime bikes overcrowded and blocking pavement and cycle stand around 55 baker street building Blandford street/baker street/dorset street need to clear out and fix it. Causing hazard and nuisance.

item.title: Human Forest bikes blocking pavement, 25th September
item.description:

item.title: Wooden stump fallen over, 25th September
item.description:
The wooden stump near number 1 and the alleyway has fallen over on to the pavement after being hit by council worker cutting the grass and so needs replacing back on that corner to stop cars and lorry’s parking on the grass verge .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Normanhurst Road, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many dangerous pot holes in northdown road, 25th September
item.description:
There is about 6 different large pot holes running from around 30 northdown leading up to 150 northdown, these are getting very dangerous specially for cyclist and residents are actually going a different way to avoid these, please can this be looked into.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Northdown Road, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: None of the lights in the alley function, 25th September
item.description:
None of the lights in the alley function making it very dangerous at night giving muggings in the past. One is in the alley, one is on my land but maintained by Bromley. These have nothing to do with network rail as are not connected to the station.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Park Underpass, Eden Park, London

item.title: Lots of broken glass at the bottom of the footbridge, 25th September
item.description:
Noticed lots of green broken glass at the bottom of the footbridge. Some people stepped on it this morning and got it stuck in the soles of their shoes. Lots of children use this route daily to and from school. It is not safe as it’s hard not to step on the broken glass.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Road breaking up and road sinking outside the first two houses on Quinton Close, 25th September
item.description:
The road (Quinton Close) outside of Wendene and in particular No 1 Quinton Close as a pothole/road breaking up and then a little further up, there is an area of the road that is sinking/has a dip with the road rising/pushed up. when cars drive over that area, it is scrapeing the bottom of cars. It has been like this for a while with an estimate of 6 months. I do not know if it has already been reported.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Quinton Close, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
